cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 380 miles SE of Miami, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn WNW tonight, then NW on Saturday, tracking toward the Florida Keys and up the Florida peninsula
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Keys / extreme South Florida (near Key Largo–Marathon area)

weather_observation.under_warning: Hurricane Warning and Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch is posted north of Jupiter Inlet to the Flagler/Volusia County Line (east coast) and north of Bonita Beach to Anclote River (west coast)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from Jupiter Inlet southward around the Florida peninsula to Bonita Beach, including the Florida Keys; Storm Surge Warning from Sebastian Inlet southward around the peninsula to Venice
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast Florida coast including Port Everglades, Florida Keys, and eventually the whole Florida peninsula
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (≥39 mph) likely by late Saturday; hurricane-force gusts (≥74 mph) possible Sunday as the eye passes to the south-west.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 5–10 ft above ground possible along the southeast Florida coast including Port Everglades if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 10–15 in. with isolated 20 in. possible, producing life-threatening flash flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large and dangerous surf, rip currents, and the potential for isolated tornadoes in outer rain bands.
